results.title: The Ant and the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This animated fable points out the familiar moral that we can’t play all the time but must work and save for a time of need. While all the ants labor industriously to provide for the coming winter, the grasshopper rests in the summer sun. But when winter comest, the grasshopper finds it difficult to live and it is the ants turn to sing and play. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Ant and the dove
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: One good turn deserves another is the moral of this fable by Aesop. This charming tale of an ant who, despite his small size, is able to save the life of his friend, the dove, will stimulate and delight young children.

results.title: The Answer is understanding
results.creator_credit: Associated Film Consultants and National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the difficulties involved in dealing with the problems of drug addiction. Examines the growing of opium in the Middle East, the history of drug use, the complex social patterns of drug use, the variety of pressures towards drug dependence in urban life, and the difficulty of preventing drugs from entering the United States. Elements of the drug problem in many overseas countries are also examined.

results.title: The Animation game
results.brief_description: Designed for teachers and students, this film is an introduction to animating on film. Covers drawn, model, cut-out and pixilation animation techniques. Geoffrey Rush stars as the Professor. Animation by David Johnson. Suitable for upper primary, secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Andes
results.brief_description: An account of the Andes mountain range and its effect on the climate, resources and boundaries of a nation. Illustrates the hazardous crossing of the mountains by foot or horse, pointing out that this difficulty is a barrier to commerce between Chile and Argentina. No other credits available.

results.title: The Ancient world: Egypt
results.creator_credit: Archaelogical Institute of America, American Research Center, Egypt and Ray Garner
results.brief_description: The story of Egypt from the prehistoric period to the time of the Ptolemies. The beginnings of monumental art are shown at Sakkara, the funeral temple and the step pyramid. The glories of the Old Kingdom, the Pyramids, the Sphinx at Giza, and the artistry of the Middle Kingdom are illustrated in detail. Creations of the great Pharoahs are presented; the temples of Karnak and Luxor, the Colossi of Abu Simbel, and the treasures of the city of Akhenaten and the tomb of Tutankhamen. Scenes painted on temple walls showing the life of the ancient Egyptians are included.

results.title: The Ancient Peruvian
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and James Sage
results.brief_description: Explores the art, architecture, religions and society of pre-Columbian culture in Peru. Live footage intercut with animation portrays the rise and fall of these vanished people, and contrasts ancient and contemporary Peru. Music incorporates pre-Columbian harmonies based on scales obtained from tuning clay and reed flutes. Suitable for upper primary levels.

results.title: The Ancient Orient: the Far East
results.brief_description: Shows the relics of early civilizations in India, China, and Japan. From these relics archaeologists have worked out the patterns of culture of these log-buried civilizations. Ceramics, jade carvings, paintings, sculptures and works of architecture are displayed. Gives an insight into the Eastern religions and philosophies which in varying degrees have influenced western life and thought.

results.title: The Ancient Egyptian
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Leroy Leatherman
results.brief_description: The Egyptian, portrayed through the art he left behind, is shown as a practical, industrious, optimistic lover of life and the world around him. Summarizes Egypt’s primeval past, settlement in the Nile Valley, and history from 2700 BC to the Roman Conquest with an epilogue about the building of the Aswan Dam and the threat to the temple at Abu Simbel.
